review: Dr Bhumika is extremely kind and well spoken. Her clinic is extremely pleasant and clean. She makes a really good first impression and I got a very nice vibe from her. With doctors, at least for me, a good vibe is very important. I visited her for a shaky tooth. She took a look at my teeth and told me that at least 5 extractions need to be done. She said that she will further discuss my prognosis after an X-ray. I got back to her with an X-ray and she sticks to her prognosis, which are 6 extractions, 3-4 fillings and a re-root canal which has already been root canal treated before. After all the extractions, I would need dental implants, which she said would cost me 30-35 k per tooth. So basically, I would be visiting Dr Bhumika for the next 6 months - 1 year. Agreed, perhaps my dental health isn’t the greatest. But I got the feeling that her approach was quite radical. Money is one part, but the main concern here was if I really wanted to part with so many teeth, which weren’t really troubling me, except for the one that was shaking. So I discussed at home with my husband and we thought I should take a second opinion. I went to another dentist and told him the situation. He, unlike Dr Bhumika, examined each and every single tooth, poked and prodded them, asked me if I am experiencing some sort of pain, took an X-ray again. He told me that he would extract that shaky tooth superficially with just an anesthetic spray. He said that there is no need to surgically remove that tooth for now as it is deeply lodged in and when it comes out and troubles me, we can think of a course of action. As far as the remaining teeth - he said I need two more extractions maximum and he will try and save one, if he can but he won’t know unless he goes in. Lastly, he said I need only one filling and the tooth that has been treated with root canal only needs a crown and not a root canal again as it has been done perfectly well previously.  I am not from Bombay and I don’t have a family dentist here. I rely on a platform like Practo to choose someone and I completely went with all the lovely reviews she had here. I am still not saying she’s not an able dentist - just that you usually go to a dentist because your teeth is in bad shape and you want them to do everything they can to save them. For me personally, suggesting extractions straight away was extremely radical. Like the other dentist said, “even if the tooth was going to go bad in the future again, if I can save it for the next 10 years I will because you are relatively young.” Yes I am 33 years old *** ** * *** **** **** ********** * ***** ** ** ***** * ***** **** * *** *** *****
reply_text:
Hi Vijetha, I personally feel that treatment of teeth should be long lasting and extraction should be a last resort. Our attempt here is always to do the best for our patients and treat your teeth to the best of our abilities . After reading your feedback, I again looked at your X-ray and still cannot understand why anyone would recommend capping diseased teeth with hopeless prognosis. I’m a root canal specialist and believe in saving teeth but not just for the sake of it.. specially when I forsee you spending more time, energy and money in future on the same teeth and ultimately extracting them anyway. For me, that would be cheating. 
Anyway, you know what’s best for you and we wish you all the best.
